images.caption: Figure 1:Visualizations (Left) of the original LoRA(Hu etal.,2022)and (Right) of our proposed method DeLoRA. In addition to the low-rank matricesB,A叼B,Aitalic_B , italic_A, we introduce a normalization\Xiroman_and a scaling factor位\lambdaitalic_位, which effectively decouple the angular learning from the adaptation strength.

Figure 2:Learning rate robustness plots in Subject-driven generation task in terms of DINO scores (Left) and Euclidean distance between a finetuned vs pretrained projection layer weights (Right). Learning rates used for robustness evaluation were derived by multiplying the base learning rate in a range of factors.

Figure 3:(Left) Euclidean Distance of finetuned weights to pretrained weights as a function of the number of training steps. (Right) Qualitative examples show that LoRA exhibits significant artifacts earlier in the process compared to DeLoRA, which maintains better image quality.

images.caption: Figure 6:Learning rate robustness plots for DeLoRA in Subject-driven generation task in terms of DINO scores (Left) and Euclidean distance finetuned vs pretrained weights of a projection layer (Right). Ablation testing impact of increasing learning rate for boundary (位\lambdaitalic_位) or angular weights (BA叼BAitalic_B italic_A).
